page.title: 10Population
page.content:
The 1981 census recorded a total of 477 people in the two villages. Of these 105 were under 16, 295 were aged 17-60 and 76 were over 65.
The number of people working breaks down as follows. Over 16 years of age, 375. People in full or part-time work, 209. Inactive people (students or retired), 166.
Housing consists of 174 households of which 104 are owner occupied, 32 are council owned, 23 are private rented, 15 are attached to employers.
Social class is mainly agricultural working.
Deaths recorded from 1965-1985 numbered 105 in Tunstall, and 15 in Halvergate.
